title: megamation
text: mm_set_creds() installs API credentials .Renviron, safe place secrets. mm_get() gets data automatically uses credentials.

title: megamation
text: mm_get() takes name-value pairs filter speed request. always returns tibble. (, show R code privacy data.) values can prefixed Megamation’s modifiers: [] containing !! equal >> greater << less <> . Instead using <> dates, use sequence dates:
code: mm_get("workorder", building_id = c("001", "002")) mm_get("workorder", trade = c("[]PCO", "[]DM")) jan_2023 <- seq.Date(   as.Date("2023-01-01"),     as.Date("2023-01-31"),    by = "day"   ) mm_get("workorder", date = jan_2023)

title: megamation
text: mm_get() uses four main functions: mm_request() create request. mm_req_perform() perform request return response. mm_resp_parse() parse response. parsed_extract() extract data parsed response.

title: megamation
text: mm_request() prints request without performing :

title: megamation
text: mm_req_perform() performs request returns list API responses.

title: megamation
text: mm_resp_parse() parses body response, contains raw bytes, returns list.

what: Extract Data From the Parsed Response
title: megamation
text: parsed_extract() extracts data interest parsed body.

title: Extract error body from a Megamation API response — mm_error_body
code: fake_mm_resp <- httr2::response_json(   body = list(     detail = "This is a fake detail/message from the API's response.")     ) mm_error_body(resp) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'resp' not found

what: Perform a GET request to Megamation's API — mm_get
title: Perform a GET request to Megamation's API — mm_get
text: mm_get() accomplishes full process GET request: Creates API request defines behaviour. Performs request fetches response. Converts body response data frame. applicable, pagination automatically applied request mm_req_paginate() returned pages automatically combined.

title: Perform a GET request to Megamation's API — mm_get
Perform a GET request to Megamation's API — mm_get
text: endpoint API endpoint. example, "timecard" employee transactions, "workorder" work orders. endpoints listed https://apidocs.megamation.com/. ... <dynamic-dots> Name-value pairs filter request. name lower-case name field filter-enabled (Megamation's words, criteria).

title: Perform a GET request to Megamation's API — mm_get
text: data frame class tbl_df containing requested information.

title: Perform a GET request to Megamation's API — mm_get
code: if (FALSE) { # httr2::secret_has_key("HTTR2_KEY")  # For status endpoint  mm_get("status") } if (FALSE) { # You can supply vectors to filtering variables mm_get("workorder", wo_no = c("00001", "00002"))  # You can supply API modifiers when filtering mm_get("workorder", trade = "[]PCO")  # You must supply date types to the date filter jan_2023 <- seq.Date(   as.Date("2023-01-01"),   as.Date("2023-01-31"),   by = "day"   )  mm_get("employee", date = jan_2023) }

what: Create a Megamation API request — mm_request
title: Create a Megamation API request — mm_request
text: mm_request() creates request using httr2::request() following: Inserts base URL using environment variable MEGAMATION_URL .Renviron. key base URL can set using mm_set_creds(). Appends URL endpoint defined parameter endpoint. Appends URL filtering defined parameter ... <dynamic-dots>. Sets user-agent GitHub megamation package. Authenticates request HTTP basic authentication using environment variables MEGAMATION_KEY MEGAMATION_URL .Renviron. Handles HTTP errors useful information response extracted (e.g. "response body"). Automatic caching responses. See httr2::req_cache(). create GET request mm_request(), can Paginate request using mm_req_paginate(). Perform request fetch response using httr2::req_perform() httr2::req_perform_iteratively() request paginated. Alternatively, mm_get() can define, paginate, perform GET request.

title: Create a Megamation API request — mm_request
Create a Megamation API request — mm_request
text: endpoint API endpoint. example, "timecard" employee transactions, "workorder" work orders. endpoints listed https://apidocs.megamation.com/. ... <dynamic-dots> Name-value pairs filter request. name lower-case name field filter-enabled (Megamation's words, criteria). allfields TRUE, return fields set available endpoint.

title: Create a Megamation API request — mm_request
text: object class httr2_request.

text: resp API response.

title: Extract and parse body from Megamation API response — mm_resp_parse
text: mm_resp_parse() extracts raw bytes API response parses , returning R list object. converting bytes characters, encoding done resolve UTF-8 issue Megamation's side.

what: Install Megamation credentials in your .Renviron file for repeated use — mm_set_creds
title: Install Megamation credentials in your .Renviron file for repeated use — mm_set_creds
text: function adds Megamation API key base URL .Renviron file can called securely without stored code. installed two credentials, mm_request() mm_get() call automatically. can called manually time Sys.getenv("MEGAMATION_KEY") Sys.getenv("MEGAMATION_URL"). .Renviron file, function create one . already .Renviron file, function append key existing file, making backup original file disaster recovery purposes.

title: Install Megamation credentials in your .Renviron file for repeated use — mm_set_creds
Install Megamation credentials in your .Renviron file for repeated use — mm_set_creds
text: key API key provided Megamation formatted quotes. url API base URL provided Megamation formatted quotes. overwrite TRUE, overwrite existing Megamation credentials already .Renviron file.

title: Install Megamation credentials in your .Renviron file for repeated use — mm_set_creds
code: if (FALSE) { mm_set_creds(   key = "<YOUR-MEGAMATION_KEY>",   url = "<YOUR-MEGAMATION_URL>" ) # Reload your environment so you can use the credentials # without restarting R readRenviron("~/.Renviron") # You can check it with: Sys.getenv("MEGAMATION_KEY")  # If you need to overwrite existing credentials: mm_set_creds(   key = "<YOUR-MEGAMATION_KEY>",   url = "<YOUR-MEGAMATION_URL>",   overwrite = TRUE ) # Reload your environment to use the credentials }
